<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Good morning and Happy Halloween.</strong><span> Like Babe Ruth lifting his bat to call his shot, we lifted our fingers to call our shot⁠—typing last week that the Nationals would win the World Series in seven games. </span><span> </span><wbr></wbr><span>Congrats to Nats fans on their victory, but more importantly, congrats to us.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span class="c-mrkdwn__br" data-stringify-type="paragraph-break"></span><span>So...Vegas for March Madness?</span></p>

</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. markets: </strong></span><span>All it took for the S&P to close at a </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/30/stock-market-fed-rate-decision-and-earnings-in-focus-on-wall-street.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record</a></span><span>? <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/30/fed-cuts-rates-one-time-amid-lower-business-investment?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jerome Powell Has the Perfect Costume for Tonight
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Jerome Powell in a Halloween costume " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1572466019.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Jerome Powell in a Halloween costume " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1572466019.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s kitty ears getup from last Halloween has been hard to erase from your mind, so this year we’re floating a more conservative costume idea: insurance salesman.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Yesterday, the Fed cut benchmark interest rates</strong> for the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/30/business/economy/federal-reserve-interest-rates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third time</a> this year in an effort to insure the U.S. economy against risks like the U.S.-China trade war, the 2020 election, and <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/30/business/economy/us-gdp-growth.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">concerns about the future</a> of this 10-year economic growth spurt—all of which have put <em>slowing business investment</em> in the spotlight.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Shield your eyes</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That spotlight got brighter yesterday when the Commerce Dept. said GDP (the value of all goods and services produced) <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-30/u-s-economy-holds-up-with-1-9-growth-on-consumer-strength?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expanded</a> at an annualized rate of 1.9% in Q3. While that <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/aa5df086-fb08-11e9-98fd-4d6c20050229?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topped</a> the 1.6% growth rate most economists expected, it fell slightly from 2% a quarter earlier. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Digging deeper: </strong>Business spending <a href="https://www.axios.com/us-gdp-third-quarter-economic-growth-1185b744-8b0e-43ed-8fdc-90d161fa23d5.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dead-legged growth</a> last quarter as investments in categories like equipment, buildings, and software fell 3% annually. That drop could be a side effect of trade- and D.C.-bred uncertainty.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Most of Q3’s GDP growth </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-economy-grew-at-1-9-rate-in-third-quarter-11572438761?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">came from consumers</a></span><span>, whose household spending accounts for more than two-thirds of GDP. Give your wallet a pat on the back. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The GDP reading was taken as a “that’ll do” kind of report. It wasn’t a) the 3.1% GDP growth we saw earlier this year or b) the 3% annual growth the Trump administration has promised...but it’s still not trail-mix-instead-of-Reese’s bad.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">~2% economic growth is still solid, the labor market is consistently an MVP, and as we mentioned already, the S&P just closed at a record. And after yesterday’s announcement, the Fed <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-cuts-rates-by-quarter-point-11572458556?mod=article_inline&mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">probably won’t</a> cut rates again this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For now, it looks like any threat of a sharp economic slowdown before New Year’s should be taken about as seriously as the Hash Slinging Slasher.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F30%2Ffed-cuts-rates-one-time-amid-lower-business-investment" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/30/twitter-stop-accepting-political-ads?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Twitter to Stop Accepting Political Ads (1/)
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey yesterday announced the platform will no longer accept political ads of any kind.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1572475658.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://twitter.com/jack/status/1189634360472829952?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@jack</a></sup></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The reasoning: </strong>“A political message <a href="https://www.axios.com/twitter-stop-accepting-political-ads-1f2bc659-b93a-4189-a60e-7bfc47227653.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earns reach</a> when people decide to follow an account or retweet. Paying for reach removes that decision, forcing highly optimized and targeted political messages on people,” Dorsey tweeted. “We believe this decision should not be compromised by money.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That’s a big deal, </strong>even if you only use Twitter to follow @Otter_News. Big Tech has been fiercely criticized in recent months over its handling of paid political content—especially ads that contain <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/twitter-to-no-longer-accept-political-ads-11572466313?mod=hp_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">misinformation</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twitter’s strategy is a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-30/twitter-to-ban-political-advertising-globally-ceo-dorsey-says?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">direct 180</a> from Facebook’s, which has said (and said and said) it’s not in the business of fact-checking ads from politicians or campaigns. But...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the last few weeks, hundreds of FB employees have asked Zuck to reconsider.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And 2020 presidential hopeful Sen. Elizabeth Warren gave FB the endearing nickname “</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/30/technology/twitter-political-ads-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disinformation-for-profit machine</a></span><span>.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The fine print:</strong> Dorsey said <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/30/tech/twitter-political-ads-2020-election/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more details</a> will be available Nov. 15, and the policy will go into effect Nov. 22...just in time for you to avoid talking about it at Thanksgiving.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/30/apec-cop25-canceled-no-literally?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
APEC and COP25 Are Canceled. No, Literally.
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Chilean protests" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyNDY3NDAyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pablo Rojas Madariaga/NurPhoto via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Chilean President Sebastián Piñera <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/30/americas/chile-protests-apec-cop25-hosting-canceled-intl/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> his country would no longer host both a) the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in November and b) a COP25 conference slated for December. Piñera said his government needed to “prioritize re-establishing public order” as it confronts massive protests. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How massive?</strong> <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-50233678?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">An estimated</a> 1+ million people protested in the capital city of Santiago on Saturday. <span>Since protests began about two weeks ago, at least</span> 20 people have died and over 7,000 have been arrested.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">APEC’s cancellation is a problem for the Trump administration</strong>, which had <span>planned on completing and signing a limited trade</span> deal with China over canapés.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The U.S. is </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/chiles-president-says-government-has-canceled-apec-summit-11572448911?mod=hp_lead_pos7&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set to impose</a></span><span> tariffs on several Chinese consumer goods categories on Dec. 15. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Then there’s COP25. </strong>Reps for about 190 countries <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-chile-protests/chile-cancels-apec-trade-summit-climate-gathering-as-santiago-burns-idUSKBN1X91QT?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were hoping</a> to gather in Santiago to figure out how to meet the Paris Agreement’s emissions targets. Now, the UN is scrambling for an alternate venue. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Trump is expected to </span><span><span>formalize</span></span><span> the U.S.’ exit from the Paris accord on Monday. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the Trump administration <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/30/us/politics/us-china-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said it</a> still expects to work out a trade deal with China in November. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F30%2Fapec-cop25-canceled-no-literally" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Pi%C3%B1era+said+his+government+needed+to+%E2%80%9Cprioritize+re-establishing+public+order%E2%80%9D+as+it+confronts+massive+protests&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/30/apec-cop25-canceled-no-literally&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/30/psa-psa-merge-fca?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
PSA: PSA to Merge With FCA
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Automakers Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot parent PSA Group <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/30/another-merger-of-equals-fiat-chrysler-peugeot-tie-up-comes-with-risks-rewards.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confirmed</a> yesterday they plan to merge, potentially <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fiat-chrysler-gets-second-chance-at-merger-this-time-with-peugeot-11572433235?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">creating</a> the fourth-largest automaker in the world. An official announcement could come as soon as today. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Is this deal the real deal?</strong> A press release from FCA <a href="https://www.fcagroup.com/en-US/media_center/fca_press_release/FiatDocuments/2019/october/Reports_Regarding_a_Potential_Strategic_Transaction.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> "there are ongoing discussions aimed at creating one of the world's leading mobility Groups." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Liberté, egalité, fraternité: </strong>This all-stock “merger of equals” would mean…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fiat Chrysler chairman John Elkann becoming chairman of the new entity and Peugeot CEO Carlos Tavares getting the CEO cubby. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-fiatchrysler-m-a-psa-breakingviews/breakingviews-cash-payout-would-help-smooth-fca-peugeot-ride-idUSKBN1X90Y9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cash element</a></span><span> to make up for the difference in the companies’ market caps. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fiat Chrysler’s been on the hunt for a dance partner for a while. About four months ago, merger talks with Renault <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/autos/fiat-chrysler-looking-merge-peugeot-after-failed-talks-renault-n1074016?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell apart</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Scale is increasingly important in the auto industry, which is moving into an uncertain but expensive future with electric and autonomous cars. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>think of this as a “save the date.” NBC <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/autos/fiat-chrysler-looking-merge-peugeot-after-failed-talks-renault-n1074016?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a> the merger process will probably continue into 2020.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F30%2Fpsa-psa-merge-fca" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Libert%C3%A9%2C+egalit%C3%A9%2C+fraternit%C3%A9&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/30/psa-psa-merge-fca&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HALLOWEEN
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/30/halloweenrelated-laws-arebizarre?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dodd-Frankenstein Smothers the Halloween Spirit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="a dog in a firetruck costume " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=446 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/c2KaeFoOGAfgA/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="a dog in a firetruck costume " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/c2KaeFoOGAfgA/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Eight in 10 Kayleys agree: </strong>The only red tape that should be anywhere near a Halloween party is Strawberry Scream Fruit by the Foot.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Halloween <em>seems </em>like the most laissez faire of the major holidays, it’s in fact one of the most tightly regulated celebrations in the world today. For example...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hello, Newman: </strong>It is a federal crime to dress up as a USPS letter carrier unless you are playing one "in a theatrical, television, or motion-picture production." Penalties <a href="https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?req=granuleid:USC-prelim-title18-section1730&num=0&edition=prelim&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">include</a> a fine or up to six months in prison. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Silly string: </strong>From 12:00am on Oct. 31 to noon on Nov. 1, residents of Hollywood, CA, <a href="http://clkrep.lacity.org/onlinedocs/2004/04-0772_ORD_176176_10-06-2004.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cannot</a> “possess, use, sell or distribute Silly String” in public. Violators could receive up to a $1,000 fine. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bless you: </strong>In Alabama, it is <a href="https://codes.findlaw.com/al/title-13a-criminal-code/al-code-sect-13a-14-4.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">illegal</a> to dress up as a member of the clergy of any religion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You’re too old for this: </strong>Anyone older than 12 is prohibited from trick-or-treating in Belleville, IL. Mayor Mark Eckert <a href="https://slate.com/human-interest/2019/10/trick-or-treating-ban-teenagers-halloween-belleville-illinois.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Slate</a>, “It’s unfortunate, but in today’s world we live in, sometimes government has to make tough decisions like this.”</p>

AUTHOR SERIES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/30/mark-mansons-not-painting-happy-picture?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mark Manson's Not Painting a Happy Picture
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="A photo of Mark Manson" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODY3L2FfcGhvdG9fb2ZfbWFya19tYW5zb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mark Manson</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's almost November, and many of you are probably arming yourselves with rhetorical ammo ahead of family holiday dinners. Remember the good ol' days when asking to pass the gravy didn't devolve into debates about the freedom dividend?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You're not the only one. But breakdowns in public discourse may not just be a U.S. problem...or the only problem. Bestselling author Mark Manson is back and sharing this worldview in his new book, <a href="https://markmanson.net/books/everything-is-fucked?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Everything is F*cked</em></a>. Think of it as self help for people who don't like self help—and who don't take themselves too seriously. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mental health, technology, politics...they're all changing how we view our lives, goals, and the world. So what can we do about it? For the Brew's Pumpkin Spice Author Series, Manson spoke with us about:  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Why limiting yourself might be a </span><span><em>good</em></span><span> thing</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How to move from quantity to quality </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why so many people shy away from self-help books</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/30/interview-everything-fcked-author-mark-manson?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out our full conversation here.</a></p>

Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe know Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s kitty ears getup from last Halloween has been hard to erase from your mind, so this year we’re floating a more conservative costume idea: insurance salesman.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYesterday, the Fed cut benchmark interest rates\u003c/strong\u003e for the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/30/business/economy/federal-reserve-interest-rates.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethird time\u003c/a\u003e this year in an effort to insure the U.S. economy against risks like the U.S.-China trade war, the 2020 election, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/30/business/economy/us-gdp-growth.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econcerns about the future\u003c/a\u003e of this 10-year economic growth spurt—all of which have put \u003cem\u003eslowing business investment\u003c/em\u003e in the spotlight.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eShield your eyes\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat spotlight got brighter yesterday when the Commerce Dept. said GDP (the value of all goods and services produced) \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-30/u-s-economy-holds-up-with-1-9-growth-on-consumer-strength?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpanded\u003c/a\u003e at an annualized rate of 1.9% in Q3. While that \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/aa5df086-fb08-11e9-98fd-4d6c20050229?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped\u003c/a\u003e the 1.6% growth rate most economists expected, it fell slightly from 2% a quarter earlier. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDigging deeper: \u003c/strong\u003eBusiness spending \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/us-gdp-third-quarter-economic-growth-1185b744-8b0e-43ed-8fdc-90d161fa23d5.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edead-legged growth\u003c/a\u003e last quarter as investments in categories like equipment, buildings, and software fell 3% annually. That drop could be a side effect of trade- and D.C.-bred uncertainty.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMost of Q3’s GDP growth \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-economy-grew-at-1-9-rate-in-third-quarter-11572438761?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecame from consumers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, whose household spending accounts for more than two-thirds of GDP. Give your wallet a pat on the back. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe GDP reading was taken as a “that’ll do” kind of report. It wasn’t a) the 3.1% GDP growth we saw earlier this year or b) the 3% annual growth the Trump administration has promised...but it’s still not trail-mix-instead-of-Reese’s bad.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e~2% economic growth is still solid, the labor market is consistently an MVP, and as we mentioned already, the S\u0026P just closed at a record. And after yesterday’s announcement, the Fed \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-cuts-rates-by-quarter-point-11572458556?mod=article_inline\u0026mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprobably won’t\u003c/a\u003e cut rates again this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor now, it looks like any threat of a sharp economic slowdown before New Year’s should be taken about as seriously as the Hash Slinging Slasher.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwitter CEO Jack Dorsey yesterday announced the platform will no longer accept political ads of any kind.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1572475658.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"540\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/jack/status/1189634360472829952?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e@jack\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reasoning: \u003c/strong\u003e“A political message \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/twitter-stop-accepting-political-ads-1f2bc659-b93a-4189-a60e-7bfc47227653.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eearns reach\u003c/a\u003e when people decide to follow an account or retweet. Paying for reach removes that decision, forcing highly optimized and targeted political messages on people,” Dorsey tweeted. “We believe this decision should not be compromised by money.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat’s a big deal, \u003c/strong\u003eeven if you only use Twitter to follow @Otter_News. Big Tech has been fiercely criticized in recent months over its handling of paid political content—especially ads that contain \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/twitter-to-no-longer-accept-political-ads-11572466313?mod=hp_lead_pos6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emisinformation\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwitter’s strategy is a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-30/twitter-to-ban-political-advertising-globally-ceo-dorsey-says?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edirect 180\u003c/a\u003e from Facebook’s, which has said (and said and said) it’s not in the business of fact-checking ads from politicians or campaigns. But...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the last few weeks, hundreds of FB employees have asked Zuck to reconsider.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd 2020 presidential hopeful Sen. Elizabeth Warren gave FB the endearing nickname “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/30/technology/twitter-political-ads-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisinformation-for-profit machine\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe fine print:\u003c/strong\u003e Dorsey said \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/30/tech/twitter-political-ads-2020-election/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore details\u003c/a\u003e will be available Nov. 15, and the policy will go into effect Nov. 22...just in time for you to avoid talking about it at Thanksgiving.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F30%2Ftwitter-stop-accepting-political-ads\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Chilean President Sebastián Piñera \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/30/americas/chile-protests-apec-cop25-hosting-canceled-intl/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e his country would no longer host both a) the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in November and b) a COP25 conference slated for December. Piñera said his government needed to “prioritize re-establishing public order” as it confronts massive protests. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow massive?\u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-50233678?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAn estimated\u003c/a\u003e 1+ million people protested in the capital city of Santiago on Saturday. \u003cspan\u003eSince protests began about two weeks ago, at least\u003c/span\u003e 20 people have died and over 7,000 have been arrested.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAPEC’s cancellation is a problem for the Trump administration\u003c/strong\u003e, which had \u003cspan\u003eplanned on completing and signing a limited trade\u003c/span\u003e deal with China over canapés.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/chiles-president-says-government-has-canceled-apec-summit-11572448911?mod=hp_lead_pos7\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset to impose\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e tariffs on several Chinese consumer goods categories on Dec. 15. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThen there’s COP25. \u003c/strong\u003eReps for about 190 countries \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-chile-protests/chile-cancels-apec-trade-summit-climate-gathering-as-santiago-burns-idUSKBN1X91QT?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere hoping\u003c/a\u003e to gather in Santiago to figure out how to meet the Paris Agreement’s emissions targets. Now, the UN is scrambling for an alternate venue. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTrump is expected to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eformalize\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the U.S.’ exit from the Paris accord on Monday. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe Trump administration \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/30/us/politics/us-china-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid it\u003c/a\u003e still expects to work out a trade deal with China An official announcement could come as soon as today. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIs this deal the real deal?\u003c/strong\u003e A press release from FCA \u003ca href=\"https://www.fcagroup.com/en-US/media_center/fca_press_release/FiatDocuments/2019/october/Reports_Regarding_a_Potential_Strategic_Transaction.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e \"there are ongoing discussions aimed at creating one of the world's leading mobility Groups.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLiberté, egalité, fraternité: \u003c/strong\u003eThis all-stock “merger of equals” would mean…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFiat Chrysler chairman John Elkann becoming chairman of the new entity and Peugeot CEO Carlos Tavares getting the CEO cubby. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-fiatchrysler-m-a-psa-breakingviews/breakingviews-cash-payout-would-help-smooth-fca-peugeot-ride-idUSKBN1X90Y9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecash element\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to make up for the difference in the companies’ market caps. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFiat Chrysler’s been on the hunt for a dance partner for a while. About four months ago, merger talks with Renault \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/autos/fiat-chrysler-looking-merge-peugeot-after-failed-talks-renault-n1074016?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell apart\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eScale is increasingly important in the auto industry, which is moving into an uncertain but expensive future with electric and autonomous cars. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethink of this as a “save the date.” NBC \u003ca style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e the merger process will probably continue into 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS the most laissez faire of the major holidays, it’s in fact one of the most tightly regulated celebrations in the world today. For example...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHello, Newman: \u003c/strong\u003eIt is a federal crime to dress up as a USPS letter carrier unless you are playing one \"in a theatrical, television, or motion-picture production.\" Penalties \u003ca href=\"https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?req=granuleid:USC-prelim-title18-section1730\u0026num=0\u0026edition=prelim\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einclude\u003c/a\u003e a fine or up to six months in prison. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSilly string: \u003c/strong\u003eFrom 12:00am on Oct. 31 to noon on Nov. 1, residents of Hollywood, CA, \u003ca href=\"http://clkrep.lacity.org/onlinedocs/2004/04-0772_ORD_176176_10-06-2004.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecannot\u003c/a\u003e “possess, use, sell or distribute Silly String” in public. Violators could receive up to a $1,000 fine. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBless you: \u003c/strong\u003eIn Alabama, it is \u003ca href=\"https://codes.findlaw.com/al/title-13a-criminal-code/al-code-sect-13a-14-4.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eillegal\u003c/a\u003e to dress up as a member of the clergy of any religion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYou’re too old for this: \u003c/strong\u003eAnyone older than 12 is prohibited from trick-or-treating in Belleville, IL. Mayor Mark Eckert \u003ca href=\"https://slate.com/human-interest/2019/10/trick-or-treating-ban-teenagers-halloween-belleville-illinois.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Slate\u003c/a\u003e, “It’s unfortunate, but in today’s world we live in, sometimes government has
